column4: How do I access a shared folder?  On one Ubuntu box, I set a folder to be shared (NFS).  On another Ubuntu box, I went to Places > Network... but there was no listing of the shared folder.
How do I access a shared folder from another Ubuntu computer on the LAN?  Both are Ubuntu.  One has a folder shared on NFS for my IP.  But I cannot figure out how to see it.
try entering smb://<ip> in nautilus's address bar
I'll keep that in mind for smb, thanks!
refer to the samba section at ubuntuguide.org
I'll go read that now in hopes Samba is easier.  I had no idea it would be such a complex task.
both/all computers need to install samba in order for it to work?  Not just the "server"?
only the server needs samba.. samba client is built into nautilus
its actually very easy.. once you read up ubuntuguide :)
easy is a relative thing :]
hehe yeah.. just try it out.. and come back if you face any issues :)
the server's ip is 0.0.0.0?
for illustrative purposes... yes.  It's a LAN ip (192.x.x.x)
hmm.. just try smb://0.0.0.0
if I do it  as smb://x.x.x.x/ the nothing happens at all (no feedback)
just verified the machines can ping one another.
try issuing sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart on the server
and make sure that no firewall is blocking smb on the server
same results (sharename results in "could not be displayed" and without is no feedback)
did you add a samba user, following ubuntuguide?
no I didn't see that.  Here's what I read -> http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Feisty#How_to_share_folders_the_easy_way (which does not mention anyting about Samba users)
follow http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Feisty#How_to_install_Samba_Server_for_files.2Ffolders_sharing_service
sure! Do try it out though! :)
